heisigStory: Just as the Arabic numeral "8" is composed of a small circle followed by a larger one, so the kanji for eight is composed of a short line followed by a longer line, slanting towards it but not touching it. And just as the "lazy 8" is the mathematical symbol for "infinity," so the expanse opened up below these two strokes is associated by the Japanese with the sense of an infinite expanse or something "all-encompassing."
koohiiStory1: Hachi (eight) begins with the sound of the katakana "ha", and it´s approximately the same character.
koohiiStory2: The valcano hasn´t erupted for 8 years.
readingExamples: 八 (や), 八つ (や.つ), 八つ (やっ.つ)
words:
お八(おやつ): (uk) between meal snack, afternoon refreshment, afternoon tea, mid-day snack
八(はち): eight
八百屋(やおや): greengrocer
八つ(やっつ): eight
八日(ようか): eight days, the eighth (day of the month)
